questions.question: What is the main advantage of using the Breadth First Search Algorithm?

answers.a: It guarantees the shortest path between two nodes in a graph.
answers.b: It requires less memory than other search algorithms.
answers.c: It is faster than other search algorithms
answers.d: It can be used on any type of graph.

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT a step in the Breadth First Search Algorithm?

answers.a: Add the start node to the open list.
answers.b: Remove the start node from the open list.
answers.c: Expand the current node and add its neighbors to the open list.
answers.d: Choose the neighbor with the highest priority.

questions.question: What is the purpose of the closed list in the Breadth First Search Algorithm?

answers.a: To store the nodes that have been visited and expanded.
answers.b: To store the nodes that have not yet been visited.
answers.c: To store the nodes that have the highest priority.
answers.d: To store the nodes that have the lowest priority.

questions.question: What is the difference between the open list and the closed list in the Breadth First Search Algorithm?

answers.a: The open list stores the nodes that have been visited and the closed list stores the nodes that have not been visited.
answers.b: The open list stores the nodes that have the highest priority and the closed list stores the nodes that have the lowest priority.
answers.c: The open list stores the nodes that have not yet been expanded and the closed list stores the nodes that have been expanded.
answers.d: The open list stores the nodes that have been added to the queue and the closed list stores the nodes that have been removed from the queue.

questions.question: Which of the following is a drawback of using the Breadth First Search Algorithm?

answers.a: It can get stuck in loops if there are cycles in the graph.
answers.b: It requires too much memory for large graphs.
answers.c: It is not guaranteed to find the shortest path between two nodes.
answers.d: It is not suitable for graphs with weighted edges.
